Women Rights.title: Right against Domestic Violence
Women Rights.description: A woman has the right to protection against physical, emotional, sexual, and economic abuse at home.
Women Rights.law: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005

Women Rights.title: Right to file FIR
Women Rights.description: Police must register FIR in cognizable offences related to women without delay.

Women Rights.title: Right against Sexual Harassment
Women Rights.description: Women have the right to a safe workplace free from sexual harassment.

Women Rights.title: Right to Free Legal Aid
Women Rights.description: Women are entitled to free legal services if they cannot afford a lawyer.

Women Rights.title: Right against Dowry
Women Rights.description: Demanding or giving dowry is illegal and punishable.

Family & Marriage Rights.title: Right to Maintenance
Family & Marriage Rights.description: A wife has the right to maintenance from her husband if she cannot maintain herself.

Family & Marriage Rights.title: Right to Divorce
Family & Marriage Rights.description: Both husband and wife have the right to seek divorce under valid grounds.

Family & Marriage Rights.title: Right to Child Custody
Family & Marriage Rights.description: Courts decide child custody based on the best interest of the child.

Family & Marriage Rights.title: Right against Bigamy
Family & Marriage Rights.description: A person cannot marry again while the first marriage is still valid.

Child Rights.title: Right to Free Education
Child Rights.description: Children aged 6 to 14 years have the right to free and compulsory education.

Child Rights.title: Right against Child Labour
Child Rights.description: Children cannot be employed in hazardous work.

Child Rights.title: Protection from Sexual Abuse
Child Rights.description: Children are protected from sexual offences under special law.

Child Rights.title: Right to Care and Protection
Child Rights.description: Children in need have the right to shelter, care, and rehabilitation.

Police & Arrest Rights.title: Right to Know Grounds of Arrest
Police & Arrest Rights.description: A person must be informed of the reason for arrest.

Police & Arrest Rights.title: Right to Legal Counsel
Police & Arrest Rights.description: An arrested person has the right to consult a lawyer.

Police & Arrest Rights.title: No Arrest at Night for Women
Police & Arrest Rights.description: Women cannot be arrested at night except in exceptional cases.

Police & Arrest Rights.title: Right to Medical Examination
Police & Arrest Rights.description: An arrested person has the right to medical examination.

Workplace Rights.title: Right to Minimum Wages
Workplace Rights.description: Employees must be paid minimum wages fixed by the government.

Workplace Rights.title: Right to Equal Pay
Workplace Rights.description: Men and women must receive equal pay for equal work.

Workplace Rights.title: Right against Workplace Harassment
Workplace Rights.description: Employees have the right to a harassment-free workplace.

Workplace Rights.title: Right to Safe Working Conditions
Workplace Rights.description: Employers must provide safe and healthy working conditions.

Property & Tenant Rights.title: Right to Property
Property & Tenant Rights.description: Every citizen has the right to acquire and own property.

Property & Tenant Rights.title: Tenant Protection
Property & Tenant Rights.description: Landlords cannot evict tenants without valid legal grounds.

Property & Tenant Rights.title: Right to Inheritance
Property & Tenant Rights.description: Sons and daughters have equal rights in ancestral property.

Property & Tenant Rights.title: Right against Illegal Eviction
Property & Tenant Rights.description: Tenants cannot be forcibly evicted without court orders.
